DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [33]
        Medium [66]
        High [100]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Speed [SSPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [33]
          Medium [66]
          High [100]
    Set Direction [SDIR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query [QUERY]
    Beep [BEEP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
    Write Changes [WDU]
  ***Send Commands***
    Speed Changed [SPDCHG]
    Direction Changed [DIRCHG]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the ceiling fan to medium speed and reverse its direction?

To address your request, I first look at the device properties and commands. The fan speed property supports Off, Low, Medium, and High speeds with corresponding values 0, 33, 66, and 100. The direction property supports Forward (0) and Reverse (1).

The accepted commands to change these are Set Speed (SSPD) and Set Direction (SDIR), each requiring an enum parameter matching the property values.

To set the fan to medium speed, send the Set Speed command with parameter Medium (66). To reverse the direction, send the Set Direction command with parameter Reverse (1).

Result: Execute SSPD with parameter 66 and SDIR with parameter 1 to set the fan to medium speed and reverse direction.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Range 0 to 500 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Query [QUERY]
    Reset Energy Usage [RESET]
  ***Send Commands***
    Temperature Report [TEMPREP]
    Power Status Report [PWRREP]
    Energy Usage Report [ENGREP]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the water heater temperature to 60 degrees Celsius and turn it on.

First, I review the device properties and commands. The water heater's temperature can be set between 30 and 75 °C. The power status can be On or Off.

To set the temperature, use the Set Temperature (STEMP) command with a parameter in the 30-75 °C range. To turn the heater on, use the Power On (PON) command.

Since 60 °C is within the allowed range, I will send STEMP with parameter 60 and then PON to power on the device.

Result: Execute STEMP(60 °C) followed by PON to set the temperature to 60 °C and turn the water heater on.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Open [OPEN]
    Close [CLOSE]
    Query [QUERY]
    Beep [BEEP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
    Write Changes [WDU]
  ***Send Commands***
    Position Changed [POSCHG]
    Status Changed [STATCHG]

USER QUERY:
Could you open the window blinds halfway and then close them completely?

I analyze the device structure: the blinds' position ranges from 0% (closed) to 100% (open). The status property reflects Closed (0) or Open (100).

To open the blinds halfway, I can use the Set Position (SPOS) command with parameter 50%. To close them completely, I can use the Close command or Set Position with 0%.

Since you want to open halfway first, then close fully, I will send SPOS(50) followed by Close.

Result: Send SPOS with parameter 50 to open halfway, then send Close command to close the blinds completely.

        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Status
      Enum

  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]

    Temperature Report [TEMPREP]
    Door Status Report [DORREP]

USER QUERY:
Please lower the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and make sure the door is closed.

Reviewing the device structure, the internal temperature can be set between 1 and 10 °C. The door status can be Open (1) or Closed (0).

To lower the temperature to 4 °C, I will use the Set Temperature (STEMP) command with parameter 4. To ensure the door is closed, I will send the Close Door (CLOSED) command.

Result: Execute STEMP(4 °C) to set the temperature and send CLOSED command to close the door.

        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Responding
      Enum

  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Door Status Report [DORREP]
    Lock Status Report [LCKREP]

USER QUERY:
Can you unlock the garage door and then open it?

Looking at the device properties, the garage door has Door Status (Closed or Open) and Lock Status (Locked or Unlocked).

To unlock the door, use the Unlock Door (UNLOCK) command. To open it, use the Open Door (OPEN) command.

Therefore, first send UNLOCK to unlock the door, then OPEN to open it.

Result: Execute UNLOCK followed by OPEN to unlock and open the garage door.

    Filter Status
      Enum
        Good [0]

      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
  ***Accept Commands***

      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Reset Filter [RESET]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Fan Speed Changed [FSPCHG]
    Filter Status Report [FILTREP]

USER QUERY:
Please set the air purifier to high fan speed and reset the filter status.

Examining the device structure, the air purifier's fan speed can be set to Off, Low, Medium, or High, with corresponding values 0 to 3.

To set the fan speed to high, use the Set Fan Speed (SFAN) command with parameter High (3). To reset the filter status, use the Reset Filter (RESET) command.

Result: Send SFAN with parameter 3 to set fan speed to high, then send RESET to reset the filter status.

USER QUERY:
Can you enable the irrigation zone and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute?

Reviewing the device structure, the irrigation controller has a water flow rate property ranging from 0 to 20 L/min and a zone status that can be On or Off.

To enable the irrigation zone, use the Enable Zone (ENZONE) command. To set the flow rate to 15 L/min, use the Set Flow Rate (SFLOW) command with parameter 15.

Result: Send ENZONE to enable the zone, then SFLOW with parameter 15 to set the flow rate to 15 L/min.

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and can you reset the total energy consumed counter?

From the device structure, the current power usage ranges from 0 to 10,000 W, and total energy consumed ranges from 0 to 100,000 kWh.

To get the current power usage, send the Query Power Usage (QPU) command. To reset the total energy consumed counter, send the Reset Energy Counter (RESET) command.

Result: Execute QPU to retrieve current power usage, then RESET to reset the energy consumption counter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Bake [1]
        Broil [2]
        Roast [3]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SMODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Bake [1]
          Broil [2]
          Roast [3]
    Set Timer [STIMER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Temperature Report [TEMPREP]
    Mode Report [MODEREP]
    Timer Report [TIMERREP]

USER QUERY:
Please set the oven to roast mode at 220 degrees Celsius for 45 minutes.

Analyzing the device structure, the oven temperature can be set between 50 and 300 °C. The mode can be Off, Bake, Broil, or Roast. The timer can be set from 0 to 180 minutes.

To fulfill your request, I will send Set Mode (SMODE) with parameter Roast (3), Set Temperature (STEMP) with 220 °C, and Set Timer (STIMER) with 45 minutes.

Result: Execute SMODE(3), STEMP(220 °C), and STIMER(45) to set the oven to roast mode at 220 °C for 45 minutes.
